Description: Limestone jackal or dog on a plinth, wearing a collar with a pendant, or bulla.
Curator's comments: Similar terracotta figures are often called Sothic dogs, a spitz-type hound associated with the goddess Isis, possibly specifically a representation of Sothis, a representation of the dog-star (Sirius), whoes heliacal rising markes the coming of the Nile inundation. Common on 1st to 3rd century AD terracotta figures associated with the Isis cult, these hounds are also also depicted wearing a pendant or bulla (Bailey 2008). Examples from the Ptolemaic period are rare, but known from Athrabis.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-2007 6 Oct-18 Feb, Tokyo, National Museum of Nature and Science, Mummy: The Inside Story 2007 17 Mar-17 Jun, Kobe City Museum, Mummy: The Inside Story
